subject: Re: [junit] how can make an exception as a true condition
msgSnippet: ... That s exactly what I do, something like: exceptionWasThrown = e.getMessage().equals( expected error message ); In hindsight, if you do that then yeah, it
messageBody:
On Fri, 5 Nov 2004 13:29:05 -0800, Kevin Klinemeier <zipwow@...> wrote:
> If the empty block bothers you (as it does me), make more assertions:
>
> catch (SomeException e) {
> assertTrue("offending field not included in error
> message",e.getMessage().indexof("badfield") != -1);
> }

That's exactly what I do, something like:

exceptionWasThrown = e.getMessage().equals("expected error message");

In hindsight, if you do that then yeah, it really doesn't matter which
form you write the test in.
